result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Msrah R Wade was found guilty of OWI (5th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $1,800.00 plus court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments, DNA surcharge.  Payable by applying bail from 12CF492.  Any remaining balance to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison  funds.  Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program only after serving the first year of sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full time, defendant to have a part time job.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No alcohol or controlled substances.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order faxed to:  (920) 426-5601, and mailed to:  Drug Abuse Correctional Center, Attn:  Stephanie, P. O. Box 36, Winnebago, WI 54985-0036

Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 10, Judge HAVAS.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Check Packet

Defendant Msrah R Wade in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Defendant Msrah R Wade in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program only after serving the first year of sentence
-Court ordered defendant pay a fine in the amount of $1,800.00 PLUS court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments payable by applying the bail that was transferred from 12CF492.  Any remaining balance are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.

Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for 36 months
Court ordered ignition interlock for 24 months

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
 Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet

Defendant Msrah R Wade in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On Motion of the State, Court AMENDS this charge to reflect an OWI 5th.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 and COUNT 3 DISMISSED.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Surety did an address change on 7/9/15, see folder in Bail Refund Area for more information.

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
